prompt_init: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
prompt_update: You will receive a text. Your task is to create a new original text by taking inspiration from this text. Just output your new text, nothing else. Here is the text:
initial_story:
The Prince and Princess of Wales have released a new photo of their children Prince George, Princess Charlotte and Prince Louis, to celebrate Christmas.

In the black and white photo, which was taken by Josh Shinner, the children are seen sitting on a wooden bench.

Shinner also took the image used on the family's Christmas card this year.

The couple posted the picture on social media, writing "Wishing everyone a very Merry Christmas, from our family to yours! W & C".

In their Christmas card image, released earlier this month, the family was seen together in another black and white photo arranged around Princess Charlotte sitting on a chair.

They were all wearing white shirts, with Catherine, Princess of Wales, and daughter Charlotte, eight, wearing jeans, while the Prince of Wales wore black trousers along with son Prince George, 10, and Prince Louis, five, who was in shorts.

In the picture the couple shared on Christmas Day, the three children seem to be wearing the same clothes and shoes as in the Christmas card image.

The family is at Sandringham in Norfolk for Christmas Day and is attending a church service in the morning.

Catherine hosted the Together At Christmas carol service event at Westminster Abbey, which was broadcast on Christmas Eve.
stories:
The King and Queen of Denmark have unveiled a new portrait of their children, Prince Henrik, Princess Josephine, and Prince Vincent, to commemorate the winter solstice.

The image, captured by renowned photographer Mia Sørensen, features the young royals sitting on a frozen riverbank, surrounded by snow-covered trees.

Sørensen also shot the family's winter card this year, which showcases the children in a cozy cabin, all dressed in red and wearing knitted hats.

The royal couple shared the picture on social media, accompanied by the message "Wishing everyone a warm and joyful winter solstice, from our family to yours! F & M".

In the winter card image, released earlier this month, the family was seen gathered around the fireplace, with the children roasting marshmallows.

They were all dressed in festive attire, with Queen Mathilde and Princess Josephine, nine, wearing green velvet dresses, while King Frederick wore a red sweater and son Prince Henrik, 12, sported a plaid shirt.

In the portrait shared on the winter solstice, the three children can be seen wearing the same clothes and boots as in the winter card image.

The royal family is currently spending the winter solstice at their estate in Jutland and will be attending a traditional feast in the evening.

Queen Mathilde hosted the annual Julehjælp (Christmas Help) charity concert at the Royal Danish Opera, which was broadcast on the winter solstice.

The Duke and Duchess of Sussex have revealed a stunning new portrait of their children, Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet, to celebrate the summer solstice.

The image, captured by acclaimed photographer Leo Scott, shows the young royals playing in a sunlit meadow, surrounded by wildflowers and tall grasses.

The royal family is currently spending the summer solstice at their estate in the Cotswolds and will be hosting a traditional garden party in the afternoon.

Duchess Meghan is set to host the annual Summer Solstice charity concert at the Royal Albert Hall, which will be streamed online later today.
